meanings.definition: The outermost layer of skin or exoskeleton.
meanings.sent1: The cuticulae on the insect's body help protect it from harm.
meanings.sent2: She applied lotion to her cuticulae to keep her skin moisturized.
meanings.sent3: The cuticulae on the plant seemed to shimmer in the sunlight, like a tiny disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The cuticulae of the exoskeleton acted as a shield, guarding the insect from predators.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that the cuticulae serve as a barrier to prevent infections.

meanings.definition: A protective covering on the surface of a plant or insect.
meanings.sent1: The cuticulae of the leaf helped the plant retain moisture.
meanings.sent2: The shiny cuticulae of the beetle reflected the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cuticulae on the caterpillar looked like a tiny raincoat.
meanings.sent4: The cuticulae acted as a shield, keeping the insect safe from harm.
meanings.sent5: The gardener explained that the cuticulae help protect the plant from pests.

meanings.definition: A thin film or membrane covering a structure.
meanings.sent1: The cuticulae of the onion made her eyes water when she cut it.
meanings.sent2: The delicate cuticulae of the butterfly's wings were easily damaged.
meanings.sent3: The cuticulae on the balloon made it difficult to blow up.
meanings.sent4: The cuticulae of the seed acted as a barrier, protecting it from the environment.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the cuticulae under a microscope to understand its structure.
